intro: Sphondylium branca, commonly known as the branched sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant, often showy flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is well adapted to drought conditions. Its branched stems and small, fleshy leaves help it conserve water efficiently. The flowers, which bloom in spring, are usually yellow or orange and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
